TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/ScrollBar/UpperTrackVertical extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the upper part of a vertical scroll bar track. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.ScrollBar.UpperTrackVertical class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the vertical scroll bar track above the scroll box (also known as the thumb).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ScrollBar.UpperTrackVertical.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementScrollBarUpperTrackVertical1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#101](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/0d292b85-0513-4ecd-b354-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#101](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/0d292b85-0513-4ecd-b354-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the upper part of a vertical scroll bar track in the disabled state.
Docs.value: A that represents the upper part of a vertical scroll bar track in the disabled state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementScrollBarUpperTrackVertical4` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#104](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e6854f51-a3fd-4528-ae36-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#104](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e6854f51-a3fd-4528-ae36-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the upper part of a vertical scroll bar track in the hot state.
Docs.value: A that represents the upper part of a vertical scroll bar track in the hot state.
